backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor implementing the backend for a test series platform, including CRUD for tests, rankers, contact submissions, and admin authentication with session tokens.
backend/migration.mo: Motoko migration module that transforms the old actor state (which included an `adminPasswordHash` map) into the new actor state shape by dropping that field.
feature_evidence.json: Empty feature evidence report JSON file with no features listed.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Text file containing JSON summaries of all frontend source files, describing each component, hook, and page in the project.
frontend/index.css: Root CSS file that sets up Tailwind directives and defines OKLCH-based CSS custom properties for light and dark color themes including sidebar, chart, and UI element tokens.
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML entry point for the Vite/React app, mounting the React root at `#root` and loading `src/main.tsx`.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component that handles client-side routing between the public site, admin login page, and admin dashboard based on `window.location.pathname`, with a custom `navigate` helper.
frontend/src/components/AdminSidebar.tsx: Admin dashboard sidebar component with navigation links to Tests, Rankers, and Contact Submissions sections, plus logout and back-to-site buttons.
React component providing an AI-powered test generator UI with a topic textarea, difficulty selector, and display of generated questions fetched via the `useGenerateQuestions` mutation hook.
frontend/src/components/Contact.tsx: A contact form component with name, email, and message fields that submits via the `useSubmitContact` mutation hook and shows success/error toast notifications.
frontend/src/components/ExamCategories.t: Displays exam category filter buttons (UPSC, BPSC, SSC, Railway, State Exams) as both pill buttons and icon cards, calling `onSelectCategory` when clicked.
frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx: Site footer showing the brand logo, policy links, copyright year, and a 'Built with caffeine.ai' attribution link.
frontend/src/components/FreeTests.tsx: Fetches and displays a filterable grid of free tests by category, with loading skeletons and an inline `TestTakingModal` launched on test selection.
frontend/src/components/Header.tsx: Sticky navigation header with logo, desktop nav links, and a mobile hamburger menu that smooth-scrolls to page sections on click.
frontend/src/components/Hero.tsx: Landing hero section with a headline, exam category highlights, a 'Start Free Test' CTA button, and summary stats (students, tests, categories).
frontend/src/components/PaidTestSeries.t: Displays a three-tier pricing section (Basic, Standard, Premium) for paid test series with a 'Buy Now' button that opens a 'Payment Coming Soon' dialog modal.
A dialog form for admins to add a new ranker by entering student name, exam category, and score (0â€“100), submitting via the useAddRanker mutation.
frontend/src/components/TestFormModal.ts: A dialog form for creating or editing a test, supporting dynamic question/option entry with validation, and submitting via useAddTest or useUpdateTest mutations.
A modal that lets users answer multiple-choice questions for a given test and displays a scored results summary with per-question answer review after submission.
frontend/src/components/TopRankers.tsx: Fetches and displays a ranked leaderboard of top-scoring students with distinct styling for the top 3 ranks, including loading skeletons and error handling.
frontend/src/components/WhyChooseUs.tsx: A static marketing section rendering four feature cards (AI Questions, Adaptive Tests, Live Proctoring, Detailed Analytics) with icons and descriptions.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches an ICP backend actor using React Query, returning either an authenticated or anonymous actor based on the current Internet Identity, and invalidates dependent queries when the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useAuth.ts: Provides utilities for managing an admin session token in localStorage, including get/set/clear helpers and a React hook that syncs token state across storage events.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Implements an Internet Identity authentication context provider and hook using DFINITY's AuthClient, exposing login/logout functionality and identity state with status tracking.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for all backend interactions including fetching tests, rankers, generating questions, submitting contacts, and admin CRUD operations.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet that configures Tailwind CSS with a navy/gold/sky-blue design system using OKLCH color variables, custom fonts (Rajdhani and Inter), and utility classes.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that renders the React app wrapped with React Query's QueryClientProvider and the InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/src/pages/AdminContacts.tsx: Admin page that displays a read-only table of contact form submissions fetched from the backend, with loading skeletons and timestamp formatting.
frontend/src/pages/AdminDashboard.tsx: Admin dashboard layout component that guards against unauthenticated access, renders the sidebar and the appropriate admin panel (tests, rankers, or contacts) based on the current path, and handles logout.
frontend/src/pages/AdminLogin.tsx: Admin login page with username/password form that authenticates via `useAdminLogin` mutation, stores the session token, and redirects to the admin dashboard on success.
frontend/src/pages/AdminRankers.tsx: Admin page for managing the top rankers leaderboard, displaying a table of rankers with delete actions and a modal for adding new rankers.
frontend/src/pages/AdminTests.tsx: Admin page for managing exam tests, showing a table with add, edit, and delete actions backed by `useGetTests` and `useDeleteTest` hooks, with a form modal for create/update.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining custom color tokens (gold, navy, sky), fonts (Rajdhani, Inter), box shadows, border radii, and keyframe animations for the app's design system.
project_state.json: Project state manifest tracking the current version, feature list, architectural notes, and known issues for the Success Test Series Hub exam prep web app.
